responses: Hello I'm Frida, I'd be happy to help you
Good Day, I'm Frida, fully designed to help you in anyway I can!
It was a pleasure to meet you Amy...goodbye.
I'm sorry I couldn't help you, Amy. We will have a nurse navigator reach out to your shortly
Amy, we would like to put you in touch with a human? There are a few options such as the Nurse Navigators and free national hotlines such as the Susan Koleman foundation (1-877-465-6636)
Amy, do not panic, this could be entirely fat or scattered fibroglandular density which are benign. We do recommend that you schedule a mammogram.

Amy, we recommend that you follow a low fat diet while eating plenty of fruits and vegetables such as https://www.ucsfhealth.org/education/basic-facts-about-breast-health-nutrition-for-breast-cancer-prevention

patterns: I'm nervous about surgery and radiation
responses: While breast surgery has some risk, millions have undergone surgery and had healthy recoveries. For more questions about surgery or recovery please reach out to a nurse navigator. Feel free to check out this American Cancer Society resource in the mean time https://www.cancer.org/cancer/breast-cancer/treatment/surgery-for-breast-cancer.html

Studies show that consistent exercise improve results for patients with breast cancer. In fact there are many groups such as the maple tree alliance which provide support for exercise during chemotherapy https://www.mapletreecanceralliance.org/our-team/. For more questions about surgery or recovery please reach out to a nurse navigator.
